title: Tones and I leads the way with 8 NOMINATIONS followed by Hilltop Hoods The Teskey Brothers
text:
She was one of the stand-out acts at the AFL Grand Final.

And on Thursday, Melbourne singer Tones and I, 19, received eight nominations for the ARIA Awards 2019, more than any other nominee.

In joint-second place with seven nominations were hip hop legends Hilltop Hoods and blues-rockers The Teskey Brothers.

Leading the way: Melbourne singer Tones and I (pictured) received eight nominations for the ARIA Awards 2019, more than any other nominee

The Melbourne singer, who's real name is Toni Watson, skyrocketed to global stardom in March with her hit single Dance Monkey.

The track reached number one on singles charts in Australia, the UK, New Zealand, South Africa and 10 European countries.

Toni beamed as she received her slew of nominations at the the ARIA Awards Season Launch at Art Gallery Of NSW on Thursday.

Vibing: On Thursday, Toni beamed as she received her slew of nominations at the the ARIA Awards Season Launch at Art Gallery Of NSW

Casual look: The trendy musician went for a streetwear look in a Nike windbreaker, cuffed black jeans, chunky white sneakers and a Tommy Hilfiger denim cap

The trendy musician went for a streetwear look in a Nike windbreaker, cuffed black jeans, chunky white sneakers and a Tommy Hilfiger denim cap.

She has already performed at two music festivals, including Splendour in the Grass 2019, where she broke the festival's record for the biggest crowd of an opening set.

Toni's largest audience came when she was part of the pre-game entertainment at the AFL Grand Final, which was watched by millions of Australians in September.

Wildly successful: Tones and I skyrocketed to stardom in March with her hit single Dance Monkey

Despite her global popularity, the Grand Final performance was slammed by viewers as a 'shocking' set - branding act Tones and I as 'a bigger disaster than Meat Loaf'.

'The worst performance ever! Tones and I were dreadful, it made Meat Loaf look like a Grammy winner! It made Port Adelaide’s 2007 effort great!' one fan wrote.

However, it appears the Frankston-born singer did have some fans, with one viewer gushing: 'Great performance from Tones and I'.
description: She was one of the stand-out acts at the AFL Grand Final.
authors: Shive Prema For Daily Mail Australia
